question: Do you support the government provide basic health insurance for everyone? Please answer briefly in 2–3 sentences.

comments.comment: Yes, I think government based healthcare is the best way to provide healthcare. It is obvious that the open market is not able to provide for the social good, economic good or even provide good healthcare left to its own devices. Right now, it is entirely to problematic that people cannot get healthcare, there is little access to healthcrea nd healthcare is wildly expensive. We have nothing to show for it either, we have little good outcomes.

I believe the government should pay basic insurance to help people stay healthy, A multitude people are either out of work and cannot afford to pay for insurance. Other countries take care of their people Why the US don’t?

Yes I do because I believe health insurance should be a right not a luxury, not everyone can pay insurance but everyone need it at some point in their lives so I think everyone should have the right to have insurance

Yes. I believe that it's part of the purpose of government to care for its citizens' safety and happiness, which includes having a healthy population. It's also cheaper for the people as a whole than private care.
I do support that. I find that everyone should be able to get the help they need without having to worry about paying for it. People should not die because they can not afford it.

I do support it because it would force everyone to opt in and make the system cheaper and more efficient because of it, and most other countries have already done it and they seem to be getting along just fine.
Yes, this will go a long way in providing basic but important health care to the poor citizens of the country.
Yes, I think that more people who suffer from autoimmune issues would be diagnosed and stopped suffering. I think healthcare should be similar to canadas healthcare but faster.

I fully support the US government providing universal health care. American workers will not be able to compete in the global economy if they fall sick and cannot obtain health care due to its current prohibitive expense. Bearing this in mind, health care is not only a human right, but a national security issue.
I’m in support of it as something the government provides but not if it’s the on choice.

I do support basic health insurance for the country's population as it should be considered a human right to have access to healthcare. I however would only agree to this if care can be administered in a timely manner.

I do not support the government providing extensive healthcare for everyone because of the policies and monitoring of individuals that would have to accompany that. However, I do support the government providing basic care and necessities regarding healthcare to all on a simpler and scaled down manner.

I wish the government would provide basic health insurance. I don’t understand how all these other countries can offer free healthcare to their citizens, but the US, which is supposed to be the greatest country in the world doesn’t offer anything close to it. Yes there is state funded Medicaid, but to qualify your income has to be so low it doesn’t make sense
Yes I do. I believe in a nation as abundant as this one is the government's duty to do that.
I believe a public option should be available along private options. Choice should ultimately  be left to the american.
the government should do that. i support it to an extent. tax payers should get it.

I do support because I think everyone deserves the right to healthcare. It would be wrong to keep healthcare from people because they cannot afford it, and it is the government's job to make sure that all individuals are cared for and accounted for.
I support it because there’s a lot of people that can’t afford medical insurance
No. Nothing in life is free and I think the Government is uniquely bad at running things. For the sake of quality it is better left in the private sector.

Yes, I support the government providing basic health insurance for everyone. Healthcare should not be controlled by for-profit corporations who have an incentive to deny care in pursuit of profit. Only governments can promote public good without pursuit of profit.

Yes, I highly support the government in providing basic health insurance for everyone. I believe having access to healthcare is a fundamental need, and shouldn't have to depend on income or job status. Universal healthcare will help ensure fairness for everyone.

Yes I support the government to provide basic health insurance for everyone. Everyone deserves the right to equal health care regardless of how much money they have. Health care is a basic need and people should be able to get it.
Yes I support government-provided health insurance for all. I think it's the government's responsibility to take better care of its people.
No, I did not support Obamacare and I don't support this. Need to lower the overall dependency on government for everything,

Definitely. Every citizen deserves basic health insurance regardless of income. No one should have to decide between eating, paying rent or receiving medical care. Most develpoed nations already provide universal healthcare. Here in the US we are the ones behind everyone else

The US is one of the only "first world" countries to not offer universal healthcare for their citizens, it's entirely stupid for the government to spend extravagant amounts of money on the military for no reason other than flexing on other countries. This country loves to overreach to other countries over caring for their own people, not even veterans who serve the grand military get fair treatment in our healthcare industry, absolutely ridiculous.
Yes health insurance is insanely expensive. I can't even afford it. It's ridiculous at this point I would rather die than be in a lifetime of medical debt!

yes of course. everyone deserves healthcare, and the same standard of care, without regard to class, status, income, sex, race, etc. that’s the best way - probably the only way - to ensure a healthy society

I do because being healthy and having good dental hygiene ain't a privilege, it's a human right. Not everyone has the same genes, has had access to dental care, or has had the ability to sit at a cushy job their whole life; these individuals are likely going to have more issues with their health and teeth. It makes you feel like you do not matter. I am here to tell you that you can't hold a job if you are sick every day, no matter how much society expects it. Taking away healthcare is genocide!
Yes, I support the government providing basic health insurance for everyone. It seems to work for other countries that implement it. It would alleviate a lot of debt and worry for people too.

I support basic health insurance for everyone because I believe that it is the job of the government to ensure that everyone has health insurance. Also, I believe that it will help lower-income households to have better health outcomes.

I partially support giving everyone access to affordable healthcare. It's the level of accessibility across the board that I can't fully get behind. If people fall through the cracks, the plan failed.
I think that it is too costly for the taxpayer. It comes and the expense of other public services
I support health insurance for everyone provided by the government.  I think health care is a right and everyone should have access to it.

Absolutely! I don't understand how we can call ourselves (people in the US) a first world country when we don't provide healthcare for our citizens. I find it unfathomable that a majority of our citizens don't want to make sure that our neighbors have the ability to see a doctor when their sick. Ours is a sick society.
I think that I support the government providing basic health insurance for everyone. I think that it is only fair for everyone to receive care no matter their income.

I support government provided basic health insurance because it would allow more people to access needed healthcare. With private and public insurance, alike, no one wins. Either some services are out of reach due to copay cost or they are not considered essential. I believe that not only health, but vision and dental insurances should be included, as well.

I do support it. I feel that basic health insurance will provide so much relief and support towards people and stave off so many from potential bankruptcy. That will lead to more people getting covered, hospitals not worrying if they'll be paid, and less medical debt which will allow more of that money to go into the economy through other methods.

I definitely think the government should provide healthcare for everyone. With the poor state of the diet for the majority of American citizens and the amount of taxes we pay, it is only fair. At the very least we need affordable healthcare to the normal person making $40,00-$50,000 a year individually. Like $200 a month.

Yes, I support the government providing basic health insurance for everyone. I think that the population would fare much better if it did. People would get the preventative care they need and more which would lead to better health outcomes when things are caught sooner.

I do support basic healthcare for everyone. I think it would help catch potential life threatening diseases early on. Most people avoid going to the doctors until it is an absolute necessity because they do not have insurance and are afraid of the costs associated with treatment.
I think it should be an obligation for the government to provide for basic healthcare in the least as basically other developed country has a well established healthcare for their citizens.

I do not support the government providing basic health insurance for everyone. This would be incredibly wasteful and expensive. The government is not well equipped to provide insurance in an efficient or quality manner.

Yes, I think the government should provide health insurance for everyone because it is a necessity, not a want. Similar to food and shelter, healthcare is a basic human right that everyone should have. Other countries have implemented this and have made it work. The United States should follow.

Yes, I support the government to provide basic health insurance for everyone.  The infrastructure for this is already well established through Medicare.  All we'll have to do is expand it in each state.

I strongly support the government providing basic health insurance for everyone because I think health insurance is a basic right every U.S. citizen should have. Current healthcare costs are so ridiculous for the average citizen to handle that it can take months-years for them to be paid off.
Yes, I support basic health insurance for everyone. We must protect the rights for all people. To be kind to one another and make sure everyone has that support for health insurance.

Yes, I do support it because some of the private health insurance offered buy private companies are too expensive and government-run Health insurance might be more affordable for lower income citizens.

Yes I support this because most people need preventive care. This type of care goes a long way to keep society healthy. It's better to prevent problems when they're small before they spiral out of control.

I do. I think it is a basic human right that every citizen should get healthcare with the taxes they pay. I do not think that right should extend to non citizens though and if medical care is needed, it is charged back to either the person or their government.

I would be in support of the government providing basic health insurance. This has to combine or relate to current health insurances that are out there, making it easier for those in need without work/income and those with jobs/working class people.

I think the government should provide basic health insurance for those who cannot afford it. Maybe they should because they would probably end up spending less given that people would have to participate in preventive care.

Yes I do support the government to provide health care insurance for anyone that does not have private health insurance, the cost is very high to seek medical care with out having any kind of health coverage, most people can not afford it.

I absolutely support basic health insurance for everyone. A wealthy, developed nation should not let its own citizens die or suffer because they have to choose between healthcare and basic needs like groceries and shelter. It's just common sense that this should be a basic human right where affordability is not a factor.

Yes.  I have had difficulties with health insurance ALL of my adult life.  I am under 21 (20), but my mom refuses to give me insurance as she says state provided medicaid would be better.  I applied for medicaid after a psychiatric hospital visit and it took 3 MONTHS and was INCREDIBLY hard to fill out as I was getting over my psychosis.  Now, I have moved states, I dont have medicaid again, and I am waiting for my coverage to get approved so that I can get a therapist and psychiatrist.
I do support the government providing basic health insurance for everyone because every human being has the right to it. We all deserve access to health care.

Medical health insurance for everyone should be a right given to all citizens of the country. You can find examples of other heavily industrialized Western societies with these benefits with minimal downside to their government spending
I do and I believe America currently hs the worst healthcare set up. Its ridiculous that people have to decide between basic necessities and essential healthcare.
I do not support this effort. It will bring the standard of care down for the folks that pay. Everything will be busier and people will be receiving healthcare that are not paying into the system.

Yes, I do because the government's responsibility is to provide for all of its citizens. Ensuring that everybody receives access to medical care is one of the basic needs of that responsibilities. Otherwise, only the socioeconomic elite can have access to healthcare, especially good quality care.

Yes, I think the government should help everyone get basic health insurance. This would mean more people could see a doctor when they are sick. It would help make sure everyone has a chance to be healthy.

Yes, I think this would be incredibly helpful to the citizens who do not qualify for a life event and lose their insurance. It would be nice for citizens to be able to accept a bare minimum policy just in case of any type of freak accident. As someone who lost their job and didn't get life event qualified, this would greatly benefit me and my children.
No, I think that it should be private and that people should be able to choose what insurance they have. By having a basic health insurance it creates more lines and longer wait periods.

The government should implement a national healthcare system paid for by tax money. As things stand currently, a large number in the country have medical debt which in turn is the cause for many bankruptcies in the U.S. And it's not a matter of money either, because as a country, the United States already allocates more money to the medical sector than most first world countries yet our healthcare system is one of the worst in the first world. It's about allocating the money more efficiently.

Yes, it should be the bare minimum especially for a country as rich as the USA, which is the country I reside in. I am citizen and I am constantly paying taxes yet never reap the benefits like receiving basic healthcare and other programs like food assistance.
Government provided basic health insurance ensures access to all. It improves public health which in the long run reduces cost for people and businesses.

Yes, healthcare should be a considered a basic right of every American citizen. A healthy citizen makes a healthy nation. The level of care provided should be enough to maintain an individuals health to a minimum level that allows them to function within and contribute to society.

I don't think basic health insurance should be provided for everyone because of the impact it would have on private health insurance and access to certain medications that may not be plentiful. However, I do believe AFFORDABLE health insurance should be made available to everyone.

Although, I don't like the government having much control over certain things, I do think the government has a due diligence and should be responsible for providing civilians healthcare that is free or affordable. That is the least they can do for the people.

I support basic health insurance for everyone. Having access to medical care should be a right. No one deserves to suffer or be unable to get the care they need. The healthcare industry is so expensive and something needs to be done about it.
I'd say that it highly depends on various factors. For one thing, you should have to be a citizen of a country to receive its healthcare. So in general, I'd say no.
yes the goverment to provide free medical cover as a basic need by providing free medical insurance for a better tomorrow

Yes, I definitely support government healthcare for everyone. I feel that if other countries that don't have as much revenue as America can provide healthcare to their citizens, then there is no reason why American can't do the same. Healthcare should be a a right to every human in my opinion.

No I do Not support this. People who work should not get the same insurance as those who don't work. Socialized medicine means waiting forever for doctor's appts. while risking your health during that time.
I do, I feel the current industry is terrible for everyone and needs to change. I rather not go into poverty based on one accident.

I think it would be a good idea to have to government support healthcare for everyone. Other countries do it and it works great for them. It would be super helpful for others how cannot afford basic healthcare.

I support the government providing basic health insurance for everyone. It Is important that individual have access to preventive and corrective care without worrying about coverage. I feel like it’s the least they can do.

Yes because without it, everyone is on an unfair footing with those whom can afford it, afford to live longer on the average than people without. This should be a right for everyone, not a privatized industry.
Yes, I would support the government providing basic health insurance for everyone. They should already do this for their people. It should not cost anything and it should be good healthcare.

Yes, absolutely.  To be one of the most developed countries in the world, we sure do have one of the worst healthcare systems.  Universal healthcare is a basic right for all, not a privelege for just the rich few.
Yes I do. All citizens deserve a basic level of health security. People should not have to go into large amounts of debt in order to receive basic healthcare.

I do believe there should be basic health insurance for all because the government can afford it and many people are dying or going into debt because they can't afford help or treatment. I believe it's embarrassing as one of the most richest nations in the world and we are on of the only few that don't provide health care for everyone. We pay taxes yet we get little in return and the government should help all.

Yes I do We should follow the model of Canada and England I believe both of them have basic health insurance for everyone. I believe that there's so many taxpayers in this country that even their income would offset basic health insurance for everyone in the United States.
Absolutely! Health care, ALL of it, should be a given right. Not just something the elite can actually afford for real.
Yes, I think insurance should be a right, not a privilege. Every other civilized country in the world has national health insurance.

It would personally depend on the guidelines of basic health insurance as to whether I would support a government policy to provide health insurance for everyone. If the government were to provide realistically affordable health insurance to all without the cost of procedures, surgeries, or other specialist visits costing so much, I would support it. I feel that private health insurance already costs way too much per pay period in addition to the deductibles that must be met first.
yes because old people are pushed aside. eyeglasses, hearing. dental.   Every other modern country has healthcare. Ours is run by greedy crooks
Yes, not everyone is fortunate enough to afford expensive health care. There are those that are injured and can't go to work due to their failing bodies.

Yes I do. It's very important that the government provide basic health insurance for its citizens.  It's important to upholding the Constitution and fulfilling the promises of the Declaration of Independence.

Yes, I most definitely do support universal health care for all, no matter what. This is because I have experience the current system myself, and one major illness is enough to bankrupt people. A system like that must never be allowed to happen. We need to switch to universal health care because of this.

I strongly support the government providing basic health insurance for everyone. It would cut out the middle-man of the privatized healthcare industry whom pray upon the working class and siphon large funds from them without any real benefits.
I do support universal healthcare. It would make it easier and cheaper for everyone.

Yes I do. It seems like an obvious yes in my opinion, but I'm sure there's many complexities in the decision making. I think overall, the government should help keep the health of the citizens in good shape.
